edu.rit.crypto

Class SHA256

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.crypto.SHA256
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HashFunction

    public class SHA256
extends Object
implements HashFunction
    Class SHA256 provides an object that computes the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SHA256()
      Construct a new SHA-256 hash function.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void digest(byte[] digest)
      Obtain the message digest.
      int digestSize()
      Returns this hash function's digest size in bytes.

      Append the given byte array to the message being hashed.
      void hash(byte[] buf, int off, int len)
      Append a portion of the given byte array to the message being hashed.
      void hash(int b)
      Append the given byte to the message being hashed.
      void reset()
      Reset this hash function.

    • Method Detail

      • digestSize

        public int digestSize()
        Returns this hash function's digest size in bytes.
        Specified by:
        digestSize in interface HashFunction
        Returns:
        Digest size.

      • hash

        public void hash(int b)
        Append the given byte to the message being hashed. Only the least significant 8 bits of b are used.
        Specified by:
        hash in interface HashFunction
        Parameters:
        b - Message byte.

      • hash

        public void hash(byte[] buf)
        Append the given byte array to the message being hashed.
        Specified by:
        hash in interface HashFunction
        Parameters:
        buf - Array of message bytes.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if buf is null.

      • hash

        public void hash(byte[] buf,
        int off,
        int len)
        Append a portion of the given byte array to the message being hashed.
        Specified by:
        hash in interface HashFunction
        Parameters:
        buf - Array of message bytes.
        off - Index of first message byte to hash.
        len - Number of message bytes to hash.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if buf is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > buf.length.

      • digest

        public void digest(byte[] digest)
        Obtain the message digest. digest must be an array of bytes whose length is equal to digestSize(). The message consists of the series of bytes provided to the hash() methods. The digest of the message is stored in the digest array. Afterwards, this hash function is reset.
        Specified by:
        digest in interface HashFunction
        Parameters:
        digest - Message digest (output).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if digest is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if digest.length ≠ digestSize().

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset this hash function. Any accumulated message bytes are discarded, and the digest computation starts afresh.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface HashFunction
